oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of a man in hospital getting wound on his back drained
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of a shirtless man, sitting, with his back to the camera. A small tube is coming out of his back and a gloved hand is holding it up. The man holds a small white bowl below the wound to collect drainage. The reverse is labeled "Dave."

In her 1920 passport application, Margaret Croft was living at 44 East 76th Street, New York City, and listed her occupation as "Red Cross Worker." These photographs appear to be taken during her time working for the Red Cross during that year.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hospitals--New York (State)--New York; Drainage, Surgical; Medical care
Wounds & injuries; American Red Cross
